{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Galileo-board-gen2-tilt-ark.png |image1_size = 150px |caption = Intel Galileo Gen 2 Board |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = https://ark.intel.com/content/www/us/en/ark/products/83137/intel-galileo-gen-2-board.html |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = <!-- wikidevi.wi-cat.ru page, included underscores --> |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Intel |model = Galileo |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = Gen 2 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = single-board computer |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Intel Quark;X1000; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = x86-64 |cpu1_type_rev = x86 |cpu1spd = 400 <!-- undocumented --> |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit
|flash1type = NOR |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Winbond;W25Q64FVSIG; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = DDR3 |ram1type1 = DRAM |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = Micron;MT41K128M8JP-125:G; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = National Semiconductor;DP83848; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 98:4F:EE
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = Grub;0.97;; |stockos = Linux;3.8.7;Poky 9.0.2;Yocto Project 1.4;
|exp_if_types = Mini PCIe, USB 2.0, Micro SD Card slot, |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = 1 |exp_usb_num = 2 |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = 1 |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 7-15 |pwr_amp_dc = 1-2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = 5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner = 2.1 |pwr_barrel_len = 9.5 |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, 6-pin header,, populated |jtag = yes,, 10-pin header,, populated
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Micro SD Card slot, RTC, Arduino expansion |addchip = 8-Channel 500kSPS to 1 MSPS 10-Bit A/D Converter;TI;ADC108S102;;1;,,, 16-Channel 12-bit PWM I2C-bus LED Controller;NXP;PCA9685;;1;,,, 16bit I2C-bus I/O Port w/Interrupt;NXP;PCAL9535A;;3;,,, 8Kb I2C EEPROM;OnSemi;CAT24C08HU4I;;1;,,, 4.5-16V Synchronous Step Down Three DC/DC Converter w/FET;TI;TPS652510;;1;,,, 3.6V 4A Integrated Load Switch w/Controlled Turn-on;TI;TPS22920;;5;,,, Sink/Source DDR Termination Regulator;TI;TPS51200;;1;,,, 3-17V 3A Step-Down Converter;Texas Instruments;TPS62130;;1;,,, 2-Channel ESD Protection Array;OnSemi;CM1230_02CP;;6;,,, Current Limited Power Distribution Switch;TI;TPS2051B;;1;,,, Single 2-input Multiplexer;NXP;74LVC1G157;;11;,,, Octal Buffer/Driver w/ 3-State Output;TI;SN74LV541AT;;2;,,, Quadruple Bus Buffer Gate w/ 3-State Output;TI;SN74VL125A;;3;,,, Quadruple Buffer/Line Driver w/ 3-State Input/Output;NXP;74LVC126A;;3;,,, 1-Î© 2-Channel SPDT Analog Switch;TI;TS5A23159;;2;,,, |802dot11_protocols = none
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = root |defaultpass = <!-- Leave blank --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = EoL |eoldate = 06/19/2017 |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 07/2014 |estprice = 80 |upc = 735858289788 |ean = 5032037068703 |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Intel]]'' Quark X1000 @400MHz :Single-Core 32-bit X86 *Memory: 256MB (DRAM) DDR3 *Storage: 8MB NOR flash, 8KB EEPROM, and micro SD card (up to 32GB) *Network: 1x Fast Ethernet Port *USB: 1x USB 2.0 host, 1x micro USB 2.0 device port *Expansion: Arduino compatible headers *Power Source: 5V/1.5A via USB Type-C
==Links of Interest== *[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel_Galileo ''Intel Galileo'' on '''Wikipedia''' ] *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/07/16/intel-announces-galileo-gen-2-development-board-based-on-quark-soc/ ''Intel Announces Galileo Gen 2 Development Board'' on '''CNX|Software''' ] *[https://linuxgizmos.com/intel-unveils-second-generation-galileo-hacker-sbc/ ''Intel unveils second generation Galileo hacker SBC'' on '''LinuxGizmos''']
